List of all members.

Detailed Description

The Logger of RainbruRPG.

The Logger defines some macros used to log messages. You can log Information messages with LOGI, warning messages with LOGW and LOGE logs errors. The Logger also provides a assertion macro : LOGA. Simply include the file "logger.h" and LOGx("Message"); to your code. Just replace x by I, E W. To use the assertion, add : LOGA(test, "Message");.

The LOGCAT? macros are differents : it logs the message in a '--' labelled ligne. It tells that it is a continuous line of previous log message.

[file.cpp::120] II Receiving an object
[file.cpp::121] -- Object name : 'aze'

The code corresponding to this log would be :

LOGI("Receiving an object");
LOGCATS("Object name '");
LOGCATS(Object.name);
LOGCATS("'");
LOGCAT();

Differents data types can be used : LOGCATS for const char*, LOGCATI for integer and LOGCATF to log float values. Be aware of calling LOGCAT() logs the LOGCAT? values. If you do not call LOGCAT(), nothing will be logged.

A log message contains the filename and the line where the call to logger happen, a log level tag (II for information, WW for warning and EE for error) and the developper message.

The setLogLevel(tLogLevel l) method let you choose the message you want to be printed. By default, all the messages are printed but you may decide to send to the log out only the errors message or the errors and warning message. The log messages are by default send to the stdout and a file called RainbruRPG.log.

Warning:
I have desactivated std::cout calls in WIN32 with preprocessor directives. It seems that using std::cout in a GUI application causes Segfaults.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::Logger (  ) 

The only constructor of the Logger.

By default, it defines :

  • The log level to LL_INFO;
  • The log type to LOG_BOTH;
  • The filename of the logfile to "RainbruRPG.log";

It sends an error message to stdout if it can open the logfile.

Member Function Documentation

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::log ( const char *  file,
const char *  line,
int  id,
const char *  msg 
)

The main log method.

It sends a log according to the received parameters.

Do not use this directly. Instead, use the LOGI, LOGW, LOGE macros. It automatically fill the file, line and id parameters.

Parameters:
file The filename from where the call to this method happened
line The line from where the call to this method happened
id The loglevel of this message (1=Information, 2=Warinig, 3=error);
msg The string you want it to appears in the log

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::logAssert ( const char *  file,
const char *  line,
bool  b,
const char *  msg 
)

The assertion main method.

It will print your message with the Information loglevel if the condition is true, otherwise your message will be printed with the Error log level.

Parameters:
file The filename from where the call to this method happened
line The line from where the call to this method happened
b The condition
msg The string you want it to appears in the log

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::setFilename ( const char *  f  ) 

Change the log filename.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::out ( std::string  s  )  [private]

Provides a simple out method.

This method prints only the message. It is a cout << s << endl; that can print both if the stdout and the text file, according tl the log type.

Parameters:

tLogOutType RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::logType [private]

 Keep the value of the logging out type.

It tells the Logger if we want to log out on the stdout, in a text file or the both.

Definition at line 234 of file logger.h.

ostringstream RainbruRPG::Exception::Logger::oss [private]

The stringstream used to LOGCAT functions.

It is used by all LOGCAT* macros and is freed by a call to LOGCATFREE. LOGCAT allow programmers to log its content.

See also:
logCatFree(), logCat(), logCatStr(), logCatInt(), logCatFloat()
